New Records: Freddie Freeman is the second player to have multiple home runs and a triple over the first two games of a World Series. The other was Babe Ruth in the 1923 World Series.
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto delivered a stellar start, allowing only one hit, one earned run, two walks, and four strikeouts over 6 1/3 innings.
Tommy Edman, Teoscar Hernández, and Freddie Freeman all homered off Yankees starter Carlos Rodón.
Shohei Ohtani sustained a shoulder injury while attempting to steal second base in the seventh inning.
Blake Treinen struck out Anthony Volpe in the ninth inning, and Alex Vesia secured the final out to win the game 4-2.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts referred to Ohtani's injury as a 'little' subluxation and mentioned that early signs were positive.
The Dodgers now lead the World Series 2-0, putting the Yankees in a must-win situation for Game 3.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers have a 2-0 lead in the World Series, and historically, teams that win the first two games of a best-of-7 at home have won 50 of 61 series.
The Dodgers' odds to win the World Series are now -400, while the Yankees' odds are +310.
